Introduction

Lee Minhyuk, also known as Huta, is a South Korean rapper, singer, and actor under BTOB Company. Minhyuk is best known as the lead rapper, lead dancer, vocalist, and visual of the boy group BTOB.

Minhyuk debuted as a member of BTOB on March 21, 2012 with the digital single "Insane".

In 2018, he debuted as a soloist in Japan through his first EP Summer Diary. He also made his Korean solo debut in 2019 by releasing his self-composed album Hutazone under the stage name Huta.

In February 7, 2019, Huta enlisted as a conscripted policeman. He was eventually discharged on December 9, 2020.
